languages.custom: Understands all languages of their creator, and can speak whatever languages they knew while alive

description.value:
If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw.

Clubs are blunt objects meant for striking with one end, such as a knotted wooden club, a sports bat, or a riot baton. Clubs can be comfortably wielded in one hand by just about anyone. Many improvised weapons fall into this category.

Properties:

&reference[light weapon]

advancement.hint: You can increase one of your graveguard's ability scores of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Unlike with player characters, you do not gain a feat.

advancement.title: Graveguard Specialization
advancement.hint: Your graveguard gains new abilities, either as they learn from their new life or remember what they could do while alive. Choose one of the following options:

You can increase one of your graveguard's ability scores of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Unlike with player characters, you do not gain a feat.

description.value: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.
People who are trained with simple weapons are also trained in hand-to-hand combat, useful if they don't have access to a weapon.

You focus entirely on avoiding attacks.

Action - Self

Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are &reference[incapacitated] or if your speed drops to 0.

You can lend your aid to another creature in the completion of a task or help them land a devastating blow against an opponent.

Action - 1 Creature

When you use the Help action, you choose one of two effects.

  • The creature you aid gains advantage on the next skill check they make to perform the task you are helping with, provided that they make the check before the start of your next turn.

  • You aid a friendly creature in attacking a creature within 5 feet of you. If your ally attacks the target before your next turn, their first attack roll is made with advantage.

These actions are all available to all characters, but have no effects to automate in Foundry. You can use any of them at will.

For a full explanation, see @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.C3b7Ref9xEVn34Gf.JournalEntryPage.iKdgcGD8qwTF1yx7]{Standard Actions}. @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.w3jjiADMUEZNKvsO]{Dodge} and @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.gR13n0dtX2w8sazy]{Help} are added directly to your character.
